intro: Euthystachys abbreviata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures that house the reproductive parts. Euthystachys abbreviata is often found in grasslands and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
